result.execSummary:
The defendant Seth L Schumacher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order. Bond to apply.

$250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with CM's family.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.
Obtain GED or high school diploma or equivalency.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply.  Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

AMENDED CASH BOND - DEFENDANT RE-REFERRED TO BMP
- Cash bail has been set in the amount of $2,500 per case (previously posted). The defendant shall be released on a Cash Bond Monday, November 9, 2015 at 8:00 a.m.  Defendant must report immediately to BMP upon release from jail. 
- Defendant must begin intensive Out-Patient Drug Treatment. Defendant shall give a Medical Authorization to BMP to monitor treatment.  BMP shall terminate if defendant does not cooperate with treatment.
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $20,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Antonio M. or Bria S.

- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

Reporter:  Sarah Breckling
Original (Preliminary Hearing 05/14/2015) filed
to branch 12.
Copy given defendant.

Defendant Seth L Schumacher in court with attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg. Prosecuting Atty Chelsea E Wetjen appeared for State of Wisconsin. ADA: Request CT find these charges 8 & 9 transactionally related. No objection by defn. CT granted. Det. Grunewald, duly sworn and testified. Direct by ADA. Venue established. Witness Id. Cross Exam by Atty Eisenberg. ADA: Move for b/o. Waive argument. Reserve rebuttal. Argument by Atty Eisenberg. Rebuttal by ADA. CT finds PC exists defn committed a felony and b/o over to branch 12.
Preliminary hearing on May 14, 2015 at 09:00 am. Rescheduled at request of Attorney Eisenberg.
Referral to Bail Monitoring
Status conference on March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Antonio M. or Bria S.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with the family of Ciara M.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $2500.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Stephen Jay Eisenberg.  Michelle L Viste appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Initial appearance on February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court finds probable cause to adjourn initial appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
